thread.title_full: How would your area vote if there was a second EU referendum? Use our interactive tool to find out

author: Michael Marsh
title: How would your area vote if there was a second EU referendum? Use our interactive tool to find out
text:
News How would your area vote if there was a second EU referendum? Use our interactive tool to find out A poll by our publishers, Trinity Mirror, has revealed that one in seven people who voted 'leave' would now vote to remain in Europe Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now How the EU referendum unfolded Share this video Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
If a second EU referendum was to take place, what would you vote? 
It appears some who wanted to quit Europe last summer may actually be having a change of heart. 
A national poll of more than 40,000 people showed one in seven people who voted ‘leave’ would now vote in, compared to one in 11 of remain voters who would now back ‘leave’. 
In the North East, 11.9% of 2,536 readers who responded to our survey said they would change their vote to ‘remain’ if they were asked again, while 8% of remainers would now leave. Read More 
Last June, the region resoundingly returned a Brexit vote last year with 778,103 voting out and 562,595 voting in. 
Every North East authority beside Newcastle - which only marginally voted remain - bolted for the exit door. 
But how would your area vote if a re-run took place? Use our interactive tool below to find out. Read More
